required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gene Correction in Autologous CD34+ Hematopoietic Stem Cells (HbS to HbA) to Treat Severe Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of the Correction of a Single Nucleotide Mutation (Adenosine --> Thymine [A-->T]) in Autologous CD34+ Hematopoietic Stem Cells to Convert HbS to HbA for Treating Severe Sickle Cell Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a first-in-human, single-arm, open-label Phase I/II study of GPH101 in approximately 15 participants, diagnosed with severe Sickle Cell Disease. The primary objective is to evaluate safety of the treatment in this patient population, as well as preliminary efficacy and pharmacodynamic data.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants diagnosed with severe SCD will receive GPH101 via IV infusion following myeloablative conditioning in an autologous HSCT setting.

primary_outcome.description: proportion of participants who reach neutrophil engraftment

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone marrow HSPC or peripheral myeloid gene correction marking
Total HbS without disease-indicated transfusion support for ≥3 continuous months
Total HbA without disease-indicated transfusion support for ≥3 continuous months
Total Hgb without disease-indicated transfusion support for ≥3 continuous months
Change in annualized packed red blood cell (pRBC) transfusion requirements (volume and frequency) for SCD indications
Assessment of vaso-occlusive crises (VOC), Acute Chest Syndrome (ACS) episodes, and other SCD-related events compared to the 2 years prior to enrollment as documented by a visit to a medical facility
Change from baseline in transcranial Doppler (TCD) velocity in applicable participants with available TCD assessments
Change from baseline in SCD-indicated lab parameters, including but not limited to bilirubin, reticulocyte counts, erythropoietin, LDH, eGFR, haptoglobin, CRP

secondary_outcome.description: hemoglobin fractions as percent of total

arm_group.description: GPH101 Drug Product is a human autologous CRISPR-Cas9 edited and sickle mutation-corrected HSPC product.

intervention.description: GPH101 is administered via IV infusion following a myeloablative conditioning regimen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥12 to ≤ 40 years
- Severe disease, as defined by having experienced at least one of the following SCD-related events despite appropriate supportive care measures:
- recurrent severe VOC (≥ 4 episodes in the preceding 2 years)
- ACS (≥ 2 episodes in the prior 2 years with at least one episode in the past year)
- Lansky/Karnofsky performance status of ≥ 80
Exclusion Criteria:
- Available 10/10 HLA-matched donor
- Prior HSCT or gene therapy
- Prior or current malignancy or myeloproliferative or a significant coagulation or immunodeficiency disorder
- Clinically significant and active bacterial, viral, fungal or parasitic infection
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding in a postpartum female
